name: Mish-Masheroo... Can I Stump You? Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these is not a 'Cosmopolitan' ingredient?
questions.explanation:
Orange Juice.

	This hugely popular drink is served in a chilled martini glass, and contains vodka, triple sec, lime juice and cranberry juice mixed in a shaker and garnished with a cherry or slice of lime.

questions.text: In the movie 'Young Frankenstein' who played Gene Wilder's sidekick, Igor?
questions.explanation:
Marty Feldman.

	Beloved Brit actor, Marty Feldman starred in Mel Brooks' 'Silent Movie' too.

questions.text: Popular TV chef Emerill Lagasse is of what descent?
questions.explanation:
Portugese.

	Who loves ya Emerill? BAMMMMM!

questions.text: What operating system did Microsoft introduce in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Windows XP.

	Billy Boy has done it again! Thanks VERY MUCH BILL... I suppose I'll have to go out and buy one now...

questions.text: Which of the following is not an area of London?
questions.explanation:
West Hempstead.

	West Hempstead is a scenic community in Nassau County on Long Island. Almost as scenic as Cricklewood which is in North West London.

questions.text: What was the name of the founder of the Chanel fashion empire (i.e. the nickname she went by)?
questions.explanation:
Coco.

	Dear Coco as well as being fashion empress was reported to be a Nazi collaborator. She formed a close liaison with Hans Gunther von Dincklage, a Nazi officer whose favors included permission to reside in her beloved Ritz Hotel. However, this cannot be verified.  Coco's birth name was Gabrielle.

questions.text: How many state names in the U.S. begin with the letter 'A'?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	Arizona, Arkansas, Alaska and Alabama.

questions.text: Who was the 15th President of the United States?
questions.explanation:
James Buchanan.

	James Buchanan was the only unmarried president of the nineteenth and twentieth centuries.

questions.text: During the twentieth century, who scored the fastest goal in FA Cup final history?
questions.explanation:
Roberto Dimateo.

	Bobby Dimateo scored in 16 seconds against Middlesboro in 1997.

questions.text: What Brit directed the Beatles in both 'A Hard Days Night', and 'Help'?
questions.explanation:
Richard Lester.

	Richard Lester also worked with Peter Sellers.
